title: Rural Municipality of St. Louis No. 431
text:
The Rural Municipality of St. Louis No. 431 (<a href="Canada%202016%20Census">2016 population</a>: ) is a <a href="List%20of%20rural%20municipalities%20in%20Saskatchewan">rural municipality</a> (RM) in the <a href="Provinces%20and%20territories%20of%20Canada">Canadian province</a> of <a href="Saskatchewan">Saskatchewan</a> within <a href="Division%20No.%2015%2C%20Saskatchewan">Census Division No. 15</a> and <a href="SARM%20Division%20No.%205">Division No. 5</a>.
History.
The RM of St. Louis No. 431 incorporated as a rural municipality on January 1, 1913.
Geography.
Communities and localities.
The following <a href="List%20of%20municipalities%20in%20Saskatchewan%23Urban%20municipalities">urban municipalities</a> are surrounded by the RM.
The following unincorporated communities are within the RM.
Demographics.
In the <a href="2016%20Canadian%20Census">2016 Census of Population</a> conducted by <a href="Statistics%20Canada">Statistics Canada</a>, the RM of St. Louis No. 431 recorded a population of living in of its total private dwellings, a change from its 2011 population of . With a land area of , it had a population density of in 2016.
In the <a href="2011%20Canadian%20Census">2011 Census of Population</a>, the RM of St. Louis No. 431 recorded a population of , a change from its 2006 population of . With a land area of , it had a population density of in 2011.
Government.
The RM of St. Louis No. 431 is governed by an elected municipal council and an appointed administrator that meets on the first Wednesday of every month. The <a href="Reeve%20%28Canada%29">reeve</a> of the RM is Emile Boutin while its administrator is Sindy Tait. The RM's office is located in Hoey.
